input: Develop an end-to-end fintech content campaign task encompassing research, multi-format content creation, consistency across channels, and measurable goals.

inputs.name: M
inputs.source_origin: Financial industry APIs (e.g., Statista, Bloomberg Terminal)
inputs.input_data: Industry trends, regulatory changes, emerging fintech adoption rates

inputs.name: C
inputs.source_origin: SEO tools (SEMrush, Ahrefs) and social media APIs (Twitter, LinkedIn)
inputs.input_data: Competitor content strategies, engagement metrics, keyword rankings

inputs.name: A
inputs.source_origin: CRM database (Salesforce) and analytics platforms (Google Analytics)
inputs.input_data: Age, income brackets, financial behavior patterns, channel preferences

inputs.name: C
inputs.input_data: Predefined structure for campaign goals, messaging frameworks

inputs.name: K
inputs.input_data: Conversion rate goals, engagement benchmarks, ROI thresholds

inputs.name: A
inputs.source_origin: Google Analytics 4 API and social media platform APIs
inputs.input_data: Pre-configured tracking IDs and event schemas

inputs.name: B
inputs.input_data: Color codes, tone guidelines, logo assets, compliance requirements

inputs.name: C
inputs.input_data: Access credentials for Canva, Adobe Creative Cloud, video editing software

inputs.name: C
inputs.input_data: Date ranges, channel-specific deadlines, compliance checkpoints

steps:
Uses: [Market Research Data], [Competitor Analysis Data], [Audience Demographics]  
Action: Aggregate and synthesize data into actionable insights  
Produces: Market Analysis Report  
Stores/Sends To: Internal shared drive (e.g., Google Drive)

Uses: [Content Strategy Document Template], [Market Analysis Report], [KPI Targets]  
Action: Draft content strategy with aligned goals and messaging  
Produces: Content Strategy Document  
Stores/Sends To: Collaborative editing platform (e.g., Notion)

Uses: [Brand Style Guide], [Content Strategy Document]  
Action: Create channel-specific content variations (blog, video, social)  
Produces: Draft Content Assets  
Stores/Sends To: Version control system (e.g., GitHub)

Uses: [Content Creation Tool Licenses], [Draft Content Assets]  
Action: Finalize and export content in required formats (MP4, JPEG, HTML)  
Produces: Finalized Content Assets  
Stores/Sends To: Digital asset management system (e.g., Bynder)

Uses: [Campaign Calendar Template], [Finalized Content Assets]  
Action: Map content to publication dates and channels  
Produces: Campaign Calendar  
Stores/Sends To: Project management tool (e.g., Asana)

Uses: [Analytics Integration Access], [Campaign Calendar]  
Action: Deploy tracking pixels and UTM parameters across content  
Produces: Instrumented Content Assets  
Stores/Sends To: Hosting platforms (e.g., YouTube, WordPress)

Uses: [Instrumented Content Assets]  
Action: Launch content across channels (social, email, web)  
Produces: Published Campaign  
Stores/Sends To: Public-facing platforms

Uses: [Analytics Integration Access], [KPI Targets]  
Action: Generate performance dashboard with real-time metrics  
Produces: Analytics Dashboard  
Stores/Sends To: Internal BI tool (e.g., Tableau)

Uses: [Analytics Dashboard]  
Action: Compile insights into executive summary report  
Produces: Performance Summary Report  
Stores/Sends To: Stakeholder email distribution list  

[DEPTH STOP] All leaf inputs (USER-CONTROLLED or SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE) are explicitly resolved.  
DEPENDENCY CONSISTENCY CHECK: All inputs used in steps; no implicit sources.
execution_plan.raw_response:
Inputs:  
1. Market Research Data  
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE  
   Source Origin: Financial industry APIs (e.g., Statista, Bloomberg Terminal)  
   Input Data: Industry trends, regulatory changes, emerging fintech adoption rates  
   Bound Reference: [Competitor Analysis Data]  

2. Competitor Analysis Data  
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE  
   Source Origin: SEO tools (SEMrush, Ahrefs) and social media APIs (Twitter, LinkedIn)  
   Input Data: Competitor content strategies, engagement metrics, keyword rankings  
   Bound Reference: [Market Research Data]  

3. Audience Demographics  
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE  
   Source Origin: CRM database (Salesforce) and analytics platforms (Google Analytics)  
   Input Data: Age, income brackets, financial behavior patterns, channel preferences  
   Bound Reference: [User-Provided CRM Access Credentials]  

4. User-Provided CRM Access Credentials  
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED  
   Source Origin: Marketing team  
   Input Data: API keys for CRM integration  
   Note: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.  

5. Content Strategy Document Template  
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED  
   Source Origin: Internal brand governance team  
   Input Data: Predefined structure for campaign goals, messaging frameworks  
   Note: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.  

6. KPI Targets  
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED  
   Source Origin: Executive leadership  
   Input Data: Conversion rate goals, engagement benchmarks, ROI thresholds  
   Note: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.  

7. Analytics Integration Access  
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE  
   Source Origin: Google Analytics 4 API and social media platform APIs  
   Input Data: Pre-configured tracking IDs and event schemas  
   Bound Reference: [KPI Targets]  

8. Brand Style Guide  
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED  
   Source Origin: Internal design team  
   Input Data: Color codes, tone guidelines, logo assets, compliance requirements  
   Note: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.  

9. Content Creation Tool Licenses  
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED  
   Source Origin: IT department  
   Input Data: Access credentials for Canva, Adobe Creative Cloud, video editing software  
   Note: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.  

10. Campaign Calendar Template  
    Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED  
    Source Origin: Marketing operations team  
    Input Data: Date ranges, channel-specific deadlines, compliance checkpoints  
    Note: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.  

Outputs:  
1. Market Analysis Report (PDF/HTML)  
2. Multi-format Content Assets (blog posts, videos, social media posts)  
3. Unified Campaign Plan Document  
4. Real-Time Analytics Dashboard  
5. Performance Summary Report (ROI, engagement metrics)  

Steps:  
Step 1:  
Uses: [Market Research Data], [Competitor Analysis Data], [Audience Demographics]  
Action: Aggregate and synthesize data into actionable insights  
Produces: Market Analysis Report  
Stores/Sends To: Internal shared drive (e.g., Google Drive)  

Step 2:  
Uses: [Content Strategy Document Template], [Market Analysis Report], [KPI Targets]  
Action: Draft content strategy with aligned goals and messaging  
Produces: Content Strategy Document  
Stores/Sends To: Collaborative editing platform (e.g., Notion)  

Step 3:  
Uses: [Brand Style Guide], [Content Strategy Document]  
Action: Create channel-specific content variations (blog, video, social)  
Produces: Draft Content Assets  
Stores/Sends To: Version control system (e.g., GitHub)  

Step 4:  
Uses: [Content Creation Tool Licenses], [Draft Content Assets]  
Action: Finalize and export content in required formats (MP4, JPEG, HTML)  
Produces: Finalized Content Assets  
Stores/Sends To: Digital asset management system (e.g., Bynder)  

Step 5:  
Uses: [Campaign Calendar Template], [Finalized Content Assets]  
Action: Map content to publication dates and channels  
Produces: Campaign Calendar  
Stores/Sends To: Project management tool (e.g., Asana)  

Step 6:  
Uses: [Analytics Integration Access], [Campaign Calendar]  
Action: Deploy tracking pixels and UTM parameters across content  
Produces: Instrumented Content Assets  
Stores/Sends To: Hosting platforms (e.g., YouTube, WordPress)  

Step 7:  
Uses: [Instrumented Content Assets]  
Action: Launch content across channels (social, email, web)  
Produces: Published Campaign  
Stores/Sends To: Public-facing platforms  

Step 8:  
Uses: [Analytics Integration Access], [KPI Targets]  
Action: Generate performance dashboard with real-time metrics  
Produces: Analytics Dashboard  
Stores/Sends To: Internal BI tool (e.g., Tableau)  

Step 9:  
Uses: [Analytics Dashboard]  
Action: Compile insights into executive summary report  
Produces: Performance Summary Report  
Stores/Sends To: Stakeholder email distribution list  

[DEPTH STOP] All leaf inputs (USER-CONTROLLED or SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE) are explicitly resolved.

aeb_analysis.aeb_analysis_raw:
### Step-by-Step Analysis

---

**Step 1**  
**Step:** Uses: [Market Research Data], [Competitor Analysis Data], [Audience Demographics]; Action: Aggregate and synthesize data into actionable insights; Produces: Market Analysis Report  
**Is AEB:** No  
**Reason:** "Aggregate and synthesize" implies multiple sub-steps (e.g., data cleaning, normalization, analysis, visualization), which violates **no sequencing** and **single intent**. Synthesis may involve branching logic (e.g., prioritizing trends).  
**Suggestion:** Split into:  
- AEB 1: Ingest raw data from specified sources.  
- AEB 2: Normalize data formats.  
- AEB 3: Apply statistical analysis to identify trends.  

---

**Step 2**  
**Step:** Uses: [Content Strategy Document Template], [Market Analysis Report], [KPI Targets]; Action: Draft content strategy with aligned goals and messaging; Produces: Content Strategy Document  
**Is AEB:** No  
**Reason:** "Draft content strategy" combines **aligning goals** and **crafting messaging**, which are distinct intents. May require branching (e.g., adjusting messaging based on KPIs).  
**Suggestion:** Split into:  
- AEB 1: Map KPI targets to campaign goals using the Market Analysis Report.  
- AEB 2: Populate template with aligned goals and messaging.  

---

**Step 3**  
**Step:** Uses: [Brand Style Guide], [Content Strategy Document]; Action: Create channel-specific content variations (blog, video, social); Produces: Draft Content Assets  
**Is AEB:** No  
**Reason:** "Channel-specific variations" implies branching logic (e.g., blog vs. video vs. social). Each channel requires distinct formatting and style rules.  
**Suggestion:** Split into:  
- AEB 1: Generate blog drafts using the style guide.  
- AEB 2: Generate video scripts using the style guide.  
- AEB 3: Generate social media posts using the style guide.  

---

**Step 4**  
**Step:** Uses: [Content Creation Tool Licenses], [Draft Content Assets]; Action: Finalize and export content in required formats (MP4, JPEG, HTML); Produces: Finalized Content Assets  
**Is AEB:** No  
**Reason:** "Finalize and export" involves multiple format-specific processes (e.g., video rendering vs. HTML minification), which violates **single intent** and may require sequencing.  
**Suggestion:** Split into:  
- AEB 1: Render video drafts to MP4 format.  
- AEB 2: Export images to JPEG format.  
- AEB 3: Convert web content to HTML.  

---

**Step 5**  
**Step:** Uses: [Campaign Calendar Template], [Finalized Content Assets]; Action: Map content to publication dates and channels; Produces: Campaign Calendar  
**Is AEB:** Yes  
**Reason:** Directly maps content to dates/channels via a single API (e.g., calendar software). No branching or sequencing required if inputs are pre-validated.  

---

**Step 6**  
**Step:** Uses: [Analytics Integration Access], [Campaign Calendar]; Action: Deploy tracking pixels and UTM parameters across content; Produces: Instrumented Content Assets  
**Is AEB:** Yes  
**Reason:** Can be implemented as a single batch API call to inject tracking parameters into content URLs. No branching or validation required.  

---

**Step 7**  
**Step:** Uses: [Instrumented Content Assets]; Action: Launch content across channels (social, email, web); Produces: Published Campaign  
**Is AEB:** No  
**Reason:** "Launch across channels" involves multiple system boundaries (e.g., social APIs, email platforms, CMS), violating **one system boundary**.  
**Suggestion:** Split into:  
- AEB 1: Publish content to social media platforms.  
- AEB 2: Deploy email campaigns via email service provider.  
- AEB 3: Upload web content to CMS.  

---

**Step 8**  
**Step:** Uses: [Analytics Integration Access], [KPI Targets]; Action: Generate performance dashboard with real-time metrics; Produces: Analytics Dashboard  
**Is AEB:** Yes  
**Reason:** Single API call to a BI tool (e.g., Google Data Studio/Tableau) to generate a dashboard with predefined metrics. No branching or sequencing.  

---

**Step 9**  
**Step:** Uses: [Analytics Dashboard]; Action: Compile insights into executive summary report; Produces: Performance Summary Report  
**Is AEB:** No  
**Reason:** "Compile insights" may involve filtering/summarizing data based on stakeholder priorities (branching) and requires validation (e.g., outlier detection).  
**Suggestion:** Split into:  
- AEB 1: Extract KPI summaries from the dashboard.  
- AEB 2: Generate PDF report with executive summary template.  

---

### Summary of AEB-Compliant Steps  
**AEBs:** Steps 5, 6,
